about-me.snippet: Despite gaining much from university, after graduating it was time for change and a new challenge. This partially came in the form of learning to code. After many hours of independent learning, some internship experience an intensive bootcamp and several freelance projects, a mound of professional and technical understanding has been gained- and there's still so much more to learn and create.
about-me.values: That which is valued in Life can determine so much of who we are. It is personally felt important to bring such fundamental parts of ourselves into everything we do, including our work. Doing so can encourage passion, pride and fulfillment
about-me.likes: Whilst programming is enjoyable, fulfilling and a personal passion, other hobbies include - writing, cooking, exercising, socialising and listening to music.

education.intro: "Rome was not built in a day" and a good developer is not created overnight. Progress and achievement attained often came with struggle and hard work.
education.selfTaught: The beginning was probably the hardest part. Entering the unknown without much guidance was difficult. However after hours and hours of working through free online content, doing courses and attending multiple meetups, a fairly solid foundation was created. It also became clear how much there was to truly learn, and that often the best way to grow is through independent learning.
education.bootcamp: The course was great. It was fun, it was difficult, it was stressfull, it was challenging all rolled into one. The days were long about ten to twelve hours onsite and they tried to cram as much into us as possible teaching us - front-end (HTML/CSS, Javascript, Jquery, React & responsive design), back-end (Python, Django, SQL) and git. There were some great people and we all learnt and gained so much through it.
education.internship: The second half of the bootcamp was a professional internship, gaving a real taste of the industry. The main challenges were adapting to the size of the code base, working heavily with other people's code and maintaining high quality code. During these two months, experience writing code in a professional setting was gained. Internship technolgies used include React, React-redux, Flask, SQLAlchemy, Docker, Git, Madrill.

contact.text: Looking to work on good projects with good people, whilst hoping to be involved in new challenges which help to enable growth and learning. Have a special preference for working on projects with good core values and which seek to affect positive change.

tour.description: Research/Consultancy based role, ongoing over the duration of a few months to create a remote live virtual tour experience for an innovative Israeli Museum.

bri.description: Birthright Israel's promotional and interactive video. A supplement during the covid-19 times this project helped provide an immersive experience showing how adventurous a trip to Israel can be.

touchit.title: TouchIt - Duty Free catalogue
touchit.description: Continuous updates, design and new feature integration for a commercially used application - a touch screen catalogue system designed for use in a well-known duty-free store.

caeserstone.title: Caeserstone - Mobile and Browser applications.
caeserstone.description: Dual, Desktop and Mobile, applications with extensive updates - new features, further design changes and general improvements made to both. The apps were designed to enable customers to select products using the designated mobile devices in-store at an innovative and popular interior design store.

troox.title: Troox
troox.description: The aim of this project was to implement a complete overhaul of the app design to provide a better user interface (UI). The App itself is a messaging app with a twist, whereby valuable 'troox' are sent to friends or family on special occasions.

images.description: The new message list, an important screen within the app, displays all incoming and outgoing messages. Each message item displays various pieces of information. The UI for this was totally recreated by myself.
Implemented the new design for all screens to provide an overall improved experience for the user by providing a much better feel to this page and all others.
Various attachment types could be added to the message - such as, videos, images, voice notes.

order-please.title: Restaurant app prototyp
order-please.description: This App, is a specialised app to improve the restaurant experience by automatically splitting the bill for clients and also easing the ordering process for waiters/ waitresses. Many features were included in the app including a QR scanning capability and SMS message generation. Just to note, as this app was a prototype design was not a priority which is why the outline is so basic. The app was dual facing, making it usable for either the customer or the waiter and consisted of multiple screens.

images.description: The menu was displayed, which was retrieved from a firebase database and displayed within the screen here.
As this project was a prototype, design was not a requirement, despite having a basic layout the app was fully functional. You can see here the amount spent by each member of the table.
Clicking on the send bill button (previous image), directs the waiter/waitress to a premade SMS message with the bill for the customers on the table dynamically created.

petwell-house.title: Petwell House Vets
petwell-house.description: Petwell House, a veterinary practice based in the UK, hired myself to recreate their old-fashioned website with a sleek and new design and layout. The new site enables customer registration as well as booking appointments.

images.description: The vets provided a range of services and as visible here they are described in flip over panels, displayed upon hovering over. The panels flipped with a smooth animation for a good user experience.

The booking an appointment was enabled on the site through using contact forms available via WordPress plugins. Submitting the form sends an email message to the vets using google API’s with all of the relevant information within.
The team at Petwell House deserved a proper website to as a testament to the good work they are doing.

fleetonomy.title: Fleetonomy
fleetonomy.description: Being involved in multiple aspects of the startup’s platform, performing front-end and back-end tasks provided a better understanding of systems with a large code infrastructure. Working with developers with many years of experience and with high standards for the quality of code triggered a recognisable improvement in coding capability. Tasks included developing front-end features, often developing from design. This startup is based in Tel-Aviv, and was mostly involved in working on their dashboard and also with their microservices for the client Jaguar- Land Rover in the UK.

images.description: Fleetonomy, an exciting startup, is fast making a name for themselves in the automotive industry.
Here is a screenshot example for one of the pages I created for their dashboard. This screen enabled filtering by date and search queries as well.
Feel free to read about some of the great things they are doing in the automotive industry.

apple.title: Recreation of the apple homepage!
apple.description: This was a prime example of displaying the appropriate skills for developing from design because, whilst also implementing and perfecting the ‘bread and butter’ of web development - HTML and CSS.

images.description: This website was recreated with full device responsiveness so that it would be suitable for mobile as well.
This project was design focused, not focusing on functionality.
The end result was achieved without copying the code of their official site.

to-do.title: To Do App
to-do.description: Get things done! Using this To-do app, which utilises full CRUD functionality, and is well scaled for growth. More than a standard To-Do app, provides linking of justifications for the task via values and beliefs to help actualise their success.

images.description: Displayed here is an expanded item within the list giving full details of the task which was submitted. The web application was split into two different screens.
The panel for creating a task has several fields which could optionally be filled, including the linking of values to the task and also a description and specifications panel.
A list of the tasks, here you can see that the status of the task is displayed through colour coding. Each of the tasks could also be fully edited too .

tv-app.title: Tv Guide
tv-app.description: My aim for this project was to completely redo the User Interface (UI) for the App to provide a drastically better design and feel. The App itself is a messaging app with a twist, whereby valuable 'troox' are sent to friends or family on special occasions.
tv-app.availability: Code available @ https://github.com/view4/tvsearch; live app available upon request

images.description: The information for the app was retrieved using an API call, and the data was successfully parsed from the JSON to be displayed appropriately for the client.
Also included in the app was search capability which communicated with the backend. The data was filtered according to the user input to return the proper information.
All episodes from each TV series was visible within the app, complete with all information associated with the episode.

heart-of-a-belief.title: Heart of a belief
heart-of-a-belief.description: So this was built for fun and experimentation. The app provides a way to record various teachings derived from a belief. Life can feel overwhelming and anxiety-inducing attempting to connect with moral can often help to alleviate such pressure. The interesting thing about the code here is it is entirely dynamically rendered within Javascript Classes using only vanilla Javascript.

images.description: The teachings for each study of the belief is displayed here, organised into three different directions, with relevant teachings split into four different domains - actions, thoughts ...
The input of the study of the belief is shown here. Entries are stored in a Firebase database.

blurb.text: The decision to freelance was partially born from difficulty and dislike of working in the traditional office setting/style. It is paralleled with a deep universal desire to break boundaries, to break the norm and to embrace taking on and overcoming the next challenge. This attitude is evident in my approach to work, to embrace creative freedom, independence and to ultimately take pride in my work.
